AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: Country where the legal proceedings are taking place, country of jurisdiction
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Court: legal body presiding over the case involving defendants Ricardo Rodriguez, Jr. and Ignacio Rodriguez, Jr., with relevant precedents regarding traffic stops and reasonable suspicion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer Police Department: Employer of Officer Reymundo Reyes, involved in the traffic stop of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer, Texas: location of police department and origin of Officer Reymundo Reyes, location of Freer immigration checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas: State where Laredo is located, state where events occurred
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. 59: Intersection location with Highway 16, route taken by defendants to avoid the Hebbronville checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer immigration checkpoint: location where Agent Montemayor arrived and conducted interviews with RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR., situated near the intersection of Highway 16 and U.S. 59, location of border patrol activity
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Corpus: possible destination for vehicles inspected at the Freer immigration checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Houston: destination city for smuggled individuals, accessible via Highway 16, possible destination for vehicles
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: a two-lane road where observations were made, with sharp turns and no shoulder, used by ranchers and oil trucks, location of drop-offs for illegal aliens, has a wind farm with an office and entrance on the west side
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer immigration checkpoint building: building where border patrol agents process undocumented individuals
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Border Patrol station parking lot: parking area near the Freer immigration checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer immigration checkpoint office: office where border patrol agents inspect vehicles and process individuals, located about 150-200 feet from Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Bruni: destination, located at the southern terminus of FM 2050, reference point for drop-offs
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hebbronville: origin of Defendant's journey, location with a checkpoint on U.S. 359
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 16: location of traffic stop, route for picked up aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.San Antonio: alternative route location, reference city for directional context
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Corinth, Texas: location where the vehicle's plate is registered, a suburb of Dallas, approximately twenty to twenty-five miles south of Dallas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo: origin of travel for IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Dallas, Texas: destination of Defendant's journey, city mentioned in relation to distance from Corinth
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hertz Dallas-Fort Worth: rental car company used by smugglers to obtain vehicles
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. 359: connecting highway with a checkpoint in Hebbronville, intersects with FM 2050 to the east of the Hebbronville checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 35: well-traveled interstate highway that could be used by smugglers to transport undocumented aliens, most direct route to Dallas or San Antonio
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mills Bennett Road: dirt road intersecting FM 2050, approximately five miles south of the Freer immigration checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.San Pablo Road: location where Agent Trevino initiated a stop, extends east off of FM 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Moglia ranch house: Ranch house on San Pablo Road, near the wind farm on FM 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stag ranch trailer: Trailer on San Pablo Road, near the wind farm on FM 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Santo Nino Road: road also known as Dinn Ranch, extending to the east off of FM 2050, providing vehicle access to Highway 16
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.wind farm on FM 2050: location of windmills and wind farm office, between twelve and fifteen miles from the checkpoint on U.S. 59, with employees who regularly drive through the checkpoint, has an entrance and office on the west side of FM 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mexico: country of origin of the passengers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 16 and U.S. 59: Location of the intersection where the traffic stop took place, near the Freer immigration checkpoint
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Border Patrol station: location where IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. was held in a holding cell before being interviewed by Agent Montemayor
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: law enforcement agency encountering illegal aliens, with agents trained to observe specific behaviors and signs indicative of smuggling activity
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexico border: International boundary where roving Border Patrol stops are conducted, proximity to which is a factor in determining reasonable suspicion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Fifth Circuit: court that has addressed similar cases regarding probable cause for arresting drivers of vehicles suspected to be driving in tandem with a vehicle containing contraband
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Echo 43: checkpoint within fifty miles of the Mexico border, used as a reference point for determining proximity to the border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050 area: rural area characterized by ranches and a wind farm, with limited traffic, where vehicles with out-of-town registrations raised suspicions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Dallas-Fort Worth: destination of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and origin of another vehicle, approximately thirty minutes from Corinth, Texas, location mentioned in relation to distance from Corinth
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.San Angelo: location used in a previous case as an example of adding to reasonable suspicion
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Southern District of Texas: judicial district with relevant case law regarding reasonable suspicion for Border Patrol stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Corinth: location mentioned in relation to distance from Dallas-Fort Worth, approximately thirty minutes apart
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 85: common smuggling route that avoids immigration checkpoints, located in the Big Bend area
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Highway 385: known drug smuggling route in the Big Bend area
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Big Bend: area known for drug smuggling, located near the United States-Mexico border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.traffic stop: law enforcement action taken based on reasonable suspicion of illegal activity, assessed in two parts: justification at inception and reasonableness of subsequent actions, with a scope that must be temporary and last no longer than necessary to effectuate the purpose of the stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Supreme Court: highest court in the land, providing guidance on probable cause for arrests and interrogations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Arizona: state where vehicles were heading, potentially indicating a smuggling route or destination
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo, Texas: origin of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s travel, city located on the US-Mexico border with high smuggling activity
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Department of Transportation: organization providing traffic data and responsible for determining traffic flow on roads such as FM 2050 and U.S. 59
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Austin, Texas: location of the Transportation, Planning, and Programming Division of the Texas Department of Transportation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo Division: division of the Texas Department of Transportation responsible for the Laredo area
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.New York: state where some rental cars are registered
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Florida: state where some rental cars are registered
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Louisiana: state where some rental cars are registered
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo International Airport: location where Defendant IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. rented the vehicle and location of Hertz rental car company
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ranchitos Las Lomas: possible origin of journey for defendants if U.S. 359 was not immediately accessible
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2895: alternative farm-to-market road that would be a more direct route to Bruni
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Hebbronville checkpoint: checkpoint on U.S. 359 that defendants attempted to avoid by taking the indirect route of U.S. 59 to FM 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 59 and Highway 16: location of traffic stop and intersection where Agent Benavides met Officer Reyes
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 59: location of traffic stop, connecting highway that could be used by smugglers to transport undocumented aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.ranch roads on Farm-to-Market Road 2050: roads intersecting FM 2050, including Mills Bennett Road and San Pablo Road, providing access to various ranches and the wind farm
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.pickup location: location where smugglers pick up undocumented aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.FM 2895: alternative farm-to-market road that would be a more direct route to Bruni
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.west side of Farm-to-Market Road 2050: area where the entrance and office of the wind farm are located, between twelve and fifteen miles from the checkpoint on U.S. 59
